resources.string-array:
Do you still think that HTML is a programming language? If so, then you\'ve made a big mistake!
First identify the abbreviation of HTML (Hyper Text Markup Language)
From its abbreviation we know that HTML is a Markup Language. It\'s called markup language because it uses the . tag
In HTML there will be an opening tag and a closing tag
" <html> ... </html>"
The closing is used to indicate which format we should stop at.
When HTML was first released in 1991, it only had 18 tags and of course it\'s growing now.
Then what is the difference between HTML and other programming languages?
HTML has no logical flow, it is fully used to design the front view that will be shown to the user.
If you are experienced in several other programming languages, then you will notice that HTML and other programming languages ​​are very different
Therefore HTML is included in the category of language that is easy to understand. You don\'t even need to use any compiler to run HTML
Just save the file with .html extension and open it using your favorite browser, it will display your HTML very well
Congratulations! You\'ll soon be getting into HTML. Keep learning!

string-array.name: Step1HTMLsub2
string-array.item: HTML is constantly evolving and there are already several versions appearing, and the latest version is HTML5.
There is also version 1.0 which is the version from the first release
Regardless of the version number, they still use the same writing format. Although some features will be added or changed
Therefore we will learn basic HTML which can also be used in HTML5
In fact, the features and advantages of HTML5 will be more powerful if used in conjunction with CSS and Javascript
Because HTML is like a bone, javascript is like joints, brain and muscles, then CSS is like clothes to beautify your appearance.

string-array.name: Step1HTMLsub3
string-array.item: Now we will learn the basic structure in HTML

" <html> <head> <title>My First HTML</title> </head>
<body> This line of text </body> </html>"
The main part is tag <html> ... </html>. It works like a wrapper, all your HTML code must be inside it
head tag contains all the elements that help make HTML pages work. Especially when you use CSS, this will be studied in the future.
The <title> tag indicates what message should be displayed in the tab title in the browser
https://serverdevapps.000webhostapp.com/ProgrammerApp/ImagesHtml/html1.png
The body tag indicates our web content will be set there. Everything like text, images, links, lists, paragraphs and more.
body tag will be displayed to the user, so make the interface as attractive as possible.

string-array.name: Step2HTMLsub4
string-array.item: Now we will learn how to write comments in HTML
Comments are written but not to be displayed to the user, but only for reference and reminder for yourself or other developers
It\'s like leaving a short message in our code
" <!-- Here is your comment -->"
Comments will be very useful if your code is very long or looks complicated
Writing comments above can also be used for multi-line (many lines)
Just put <!-- at the beginning of the sentence and --> at the end of the sentence (end of line)
" <!-- this is an example multi-line comment -->"
You can put comments anywhere and as many times
But remember! Comments can increase your file size
